description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cilps","text":"This protocol describes the steps to extract and purify genomic DNA from dermatophytes (and more specifically from dermatophytes of the genus Trichophyton). The extracted DNA is then quantified by spectrophotometry. The yields obtained by this method are between 5 ng/μL and 30 ng/μL.The genomic DNA obtained by following this procotole is little/not fragmented and therefore compatible with high-throughput genome sequencing applications on the Illumina platform. We used this protocol to extract the sequenced fungal DNA as part of BioProject PRJNA956242.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lksq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"74bo5","text":"This study has been approved by the ethical committee of the University Hospital under the number 2022/46","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"d3ud","text":"Be careful when preparing the medium : work under sterile conditions as much as possible to avoid contaminating the liquid medium. Perform the DNA dosage directly after extraction and not after a freeze/thaw cycle. The NanoDrop 1000 spectrophotometric dosage overestimates the DNA yields. For a more precise dosage, please consider more specific methods. We recommend the Qubit dsDNA HS kit (Thermo Fisher, Q32851). After extraction and quantification, store the DNA at -80°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"bn2iq","text":"Qiagen DNEasy UltraClean Microbial kit (Qiagen, 12224-50).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dndg","text":"Sabouraud Dextrose Broth (Sigma-Aldrich, S3306)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working. The DNA yields obtained are low but sufficient to prepare libraries for high-speed sequencing on the Illumina platform.

{"blocks":[{"key":"c473s","text":"After allowing to cool, transfer   of this medium into a tube. Label the tube with the strain number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fpaae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"BF769EC0D47F11ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94180","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8q0k","text":"Using a sterile swab (or a sterile inoculation loop), gently collect the primary culture and dip the swab (or the sterile inoculation loop) into the tube containing the culture medium (prepared in the previous step). Close the tube halfway to allow gas exchange. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"47pbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6se1","text":"Allow to grow in the incubator at   until a sufficient flocculate is formed (requires at least 96 hours). Incubation time varies from strain to strain but flocculate should be visible after 5 days. If this is not the case, repeat the cultivation step.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6ivf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D4184C20D47F11ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"51988","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1cbpt","text":"Using a Pasteur pipette, carefully remove the flocculate from the tube containing the previously cultured dermatophyte strain. Transfer this flocculate to a PowerBead tube containing 0.1mm glass beads, let's call it primary tube. Add  of PowerBead solution and   of SL solution to this tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":234,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":261,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"131071F0D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94181","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"36335940D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94182","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3tv28","text":"Cool this tube to   in liquid nitrogen for  . Then, heat this tube in a water bath at    for  . Finally, run this tube through the cell disruptor at maximum speed for  . This constitutes 1 cycle of 3 steps. You must repeat this cycle 3 times. The recovered mixture is referred to as primary lysate in the following steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":93,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":167,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"656EB7E0D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"51989","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-196","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"6C721140D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83186","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7C8D2510D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"51990","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"8107FED0D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83187","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"90DFA100D48011ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83188","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kegp","text":"After that, centrifuge the tube at   for   at room temperature. Gently transfer the supernatant to a new collection tube and discard the tube containing the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6hoij","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A6829C50D48111ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"ADAA4690D48111ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83192","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59bh0","text":"Add   of SB solution to the tube containing the supernatant from the previous step and vortex for  . Load approximately   of this suspension into a silica membrane chromatography column (provided in the kit). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":98,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":120,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4lao0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"FC1F6B70D48111ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94184","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"23999EF0D48211ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83193","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"700","error":false,"guid":"53819140D48211ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94185","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3fiac","text":"Centrifuge the column at   for   at room temperature. Keep the column and discard the flows-through. Repeat until the entire volume from step 11 is loaded into the column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"90D97490D48211ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"96C829A0D48211ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83194","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3gnq4","text":"Add   of CB solution into the column and centrifuge it at   for   at room temperature. Keep the column and discard the flows-through. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"09585170D48311ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94186","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"18F88FF0D48311ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"2127E630D48311ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83195","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30o6m","text":"Centrifuge the column alone (empty) to remove the last residues of CB solution. The conditions are identical to the previous step :   for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":132,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":138,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7b9it","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AC99D610D48311ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"B68B27A0D48311ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83196","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f74sd","text":"Place the column in a new collection tube. Add   of EB solution to the center of the silica membrane. Let stand for   at room temperature. Let stand for   at room temperature and then centrifuge the column at   for   to elute the DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":116,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":153,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":209,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":215,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"csggm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"E8CA2950D48311ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94187","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"0DF60000D48411ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83197","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"322156A0D48411ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83198","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3D45F810D48411ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"465AF360D48411ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"83199","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4utql","text":"Discard the column and keep the flows-though which is the purified DNA. Store DNA at   to ensure stability.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5CA82DE0D48411ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"51992","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo4ji","text":"To determine the purity and concentration of the DNA, a NanoDrop dosage was performed. For this purpose, a negative control was prepared beforehand. This control will have undergone all the extraction steps but will not contain any material from dermatophytes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e15sf","text":"Launch the computer program and select the \"nucleic acid\" mode. Make sure the sample deposit spot is clean and dry. If necessary, clean it with the wipes provided for this purpose. Then drop   of the negative control and click on the \"blank\" box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":191,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"746D1440D48411ECBE8F473F810BB8C9","id":"94188","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sdo5","text":"Proceed in the same way to measure the sample containing the DNA, but click on \"measure\" instead of \"blank\". There is no need to redo a blank between measurements. Please note that the NanoDrop 1000 spectrophotometric dosage overestimates the DNA yields. For a more precise dosage, please consider more specific methods. We recommend the Qubit dsDNA HS kit (Thermo Fisher Q32851).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
